p: The yield of EO of O. basilicum increased with the increase in the drying temperature of its leaves. Similar results were obtained for lemongrass essential oil, whose yield increased with an increase in the drying temperature [ 28]. The effect of drying temperature on the yield of the essential oil of Tanaecium nocturnum was evaluated by Pimentel et al. and the authors concluded that the increase on drying temperature (30–40 °C) did not affect the oil content, but caused losses and variations in the amounts of its compounds [ 29].
